history.content:
Hi there, I agree that this is a real problem. We have (very firmly, and in no uncertain terms) expressed our very serious concerns with the way the system is built. 

Unfortunately I don't have any real advice. You can drop and add yourself to the course again, understanding that the risk you take is being very low on the wait list. You could wait it out, but I really don't know when this problem will be solved. 

I'm sorry I don't have a better answer for you. I promise to send an announcement as soon as I know more.

Edit: The EE16A faculty have said that you may attend any discussion section, however this does not apply to the lab section. You must attend the lab section in which you enroll.

Hi there, I agree that this is a real problem. We have (very firmly, and in no uncertain terms) expressed our very serious concerns with the way the system is built. 

Unfortunately I don't have any real advice. You can drop and add yourself to the course again, understanding that the risk you take is being very low on the wait list. You could wait it out, but I really don't know when this problem will be solved. 

I'm sorry I don't have a better answer for you. I promise to send an announcement as soon as I know more.

Hello,

I saw the post at @1676 and filed a ticket with the SIS team. However, I just heard back that the only way to circumvent this problem is to drop the course and re-add it with the new secondary section.

I realize this probably cannot be changed anytime soon, but this is a real problem because my new waitlist number will likely be very high. This is especially frustrating because the section I need to switch is a Lab time for EE16A, a class which (as far as I know) anyways allows students to attend any section. I have been informed that I "will never get off the waitlist for that course" since its lab time conflicts with another course I have enrolled in. 

I do hope this can be resolved eventually, if not now. However, for the time being, should I go ahead and drop/re-add as the SIS team has instructed? Or should I wait for an official EECS announcement? Thanks!
history.subject: Switching Secondary Sections for Waitlisted Class
